name: azuredevops
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Azure DevOps.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`azuredevops` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azuredevops).

orgServiceUrl.description: The url of the Azure DevOps instance which should be used.

personalAccessToken.description: The personal access token which should be used.

override.description: Override the azure-pipeline file and use a this configuration for all builds.

useYaml.description: Use the azure-pipeline file for the build configuration. Defaults to `false`.

batch.description: If you set batch to true, when a pipeline is running, the system waits until the run is completed, then starts another run with all changes that have not yet been built. Defaults to `true`.

branchFilters.description: The branches to include and exclude from the trigger.

maxConcurrentBuildsPerBranch.description: The number of max builds per branch. Defaults to `1`.

pathFilters.description: Specify file paths to include or exclude. Note that the wildcard syntax is different between branches/tags and file paths.

pollingInterval.description: How often the external repository is polled. Defaults to `0`.

pollingJobId.description: This is the ID of the polling job that polls the external repository. Once the build definition is saved/updated, this value is set.

excludes.description: List of branch patterns to exclude.

includes.description: List of branch patterns to include.

excludes.description: List of branch patterns to exclude.

includes.description: List of branch patterns to include.

override.description: Override the azure-pipeline file and use a this configuration for all builds.

useYaml.description: Use the azure-pipeline file for the build configuration. Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description: Build pull requests form forms of this repository.

shareSecrets.description: Make secrets available to builds of forks.

branchFilters.description: The branches to include and exclude from the trigger.

pathFilters.description: Specify file paths to include or exclude. Note that the wildcard syntax is different between branches/tags and file paths.

excludes.description: List of branch patterns to exclude.

includes.description: List of branch patterns to include.

excludes.description: List of branch patterns to exclude.

includes.description: List of branch patterns to include.

branchName.description: The branch name for which builds are triggered. Defaults to `master`.

repoId.description: The id of the repository. For `TfsGit` repos, this is simply the ID of the repository. For `Github` repos, this will take the form of `<GitHub Org>/<Repo Name>`. For `Bitbucket` repos, this will take the form of `<Workspace ID>/<Repo Name>`.

repoType.description: The repository type. Valid values: `GitHub` or `TfsGit` or `Bitbucket`. Defaults to `Github`.

serviceConnectionId.description: The service connection ID. Used if the `repo_type` is `GitHub`.

ymlPath.description: The path of the Yaml file describing the build definition.

allowOverride.description: True if the variable can be overridden. Defaults to `true`.

isSecret.description: True if the variable is a secret. Defaults to `false`.

secretValue.description: The secret value of the variable. Used when `is_secret` set to `true`.

name.description: The name of the Variable Group.

isSecret.description: A boolean flag describing if the variable value is sensitive. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The key value used for the variable. Must be unique within the Variable Group.

secretValue.description: The secret value of the variable. If omitted, it will default to empty string. Used when `is_secret` set to `true`.

value.description: The value of the variable. If omitted, it will default to empty string.

buildDefinitionId.description: The ID of the build to monitor for the policy.

displayName.description: The display name for the policy.

manualQueueOnly.description: If set to true, the build will need to be manually queued. Defaults to `false`

queueOnSourceUpdateOnly.description: True if the build should queue on source updates only. Defaults to `true`.

scopes.description: Controls which repositories and branches the policy will be enabled for. This block must be defined at least once.

validDuration.description: The number of minutes for which the build is valid. If `0`, the build will not expire. Defaults to `720` (12 hours).

matchType.description: The match type to use when applying the policy. Supported values are `Exact` (default) or `Prefix`.

repositoryId.description: The repository ID. Needed only if the scope of the policy will be limited to a single repository.

repositoryRef.description: The ref pattern to use for the match. If `match_type` is `Exact`, this should be a qualified ref such as `refs/heads/master`. If `match_type` is `Prefix`, this should be a ref path such as `refs/heads/releases`.

reviewerCount.description: The number of reviewrs needed to approve.

scopes.description: Controls which repositories and branches the policy will be enabled for. This block must be defined at least once.

submitterCanVote.description: Controls whether or not the submitter's vote counts. Defaults to `false`.

matchType.description: The match type to use when applying the policy. Supported values are `Exact` (default) or `Prefix`.

repositoryId.description: The repository ID. Needed only if the scope of the policy will be limited to a single repository.

repositoryRef.description: The ref pattern to use for the match. If `match_type` is `Exact`, this should be a qualified ref such as `refs/heads/master`. If `match_type` is `Prefix`, this should be a ref path such as `refs/heads/releases`.

initType.description: The type of repository to create. Valid values: `Uninitialized`, `Clean`, or `Import`. Defaults to `Uninitialized`.

sourceType.description: Type type of the source repository. Used if the `init_type` is `Import`.

sourceUrl.description: The URL of the source repository. Used if the `init_type` is `Import`.

personalAccessToken.description: The Personal Access Token for Github.

azureEnvironment.description: Azure environment refers to whether the public cloud offering or domestic (government) clouds are being used. Currently, only the public cloud is supported. The value must be AzureCloud. This is also the default-value.

clusterName.description: The name of the Kubernetes cluster.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace. Default value is "default".

resourcegroupId.description: The resource group id, to which the Kubernetes cluster is deployed.

subscriptionId.description: The id of the Azure subscription.

subscriptionName.description: The name of the Azure subscription.

tenantId.description: The id of the tenant used by the subscription.

acceptUntrustedCerts.description: Set this option to allow clients to accept a self-signed certificate.

clusterContext.description: Context within the kubeconfig file that is to be used for identifying the cluster. Default value is the current-context set in kubeconfig.

kubeConfig.description: The content of the kubeconfig in yaml notation to be used to communicate with the API-Server of Kubernetes.

caCert.description: The certificate from a Kubernetes secret object.

token.description: The token from a Kubernetes secret object.

provider.description:
The provider type for the azuredevops package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

orgServiceUrl.description: The url of the Azure DevOps instance which should be used.

personalAccessToken.description: The personal access token which should be used.

autoProvision.description: Specifies whether or not a queue should be automatically provisioned for each project collection. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the agent pool.

poolType.description: Specifies whether the agent pool type is Automation or Deployment.  Defaults to `automation`.

autoProvision.description: Specifies whether or not a queue should be automatically provisioned for each project collection. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the agent pool.

poolType.description: Specifies whether the agent pool type is Automation or Deployment.  Defaults to `automation`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Pool resources.

autoProvision.description: Specifies whether or not a queue should be automatically provisioned for each project collection. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the agent pool.

poolType.description: Specifies whether the agent pool type is Automation or Deployment.  Defaults to `automation`.

agentPoolId.description: The ID of the organization agent pool.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the resource.

agentPoolId.description: The ID of the organization agent pool.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the resource.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Queue resources.

agentPoolId.description: The ID of the organization agent pool.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the resource.

azuredevops:Build/buildDefinition:BuildD.description:
Manages a Build Definition within Azure DevOps.

## Relevant Links

* [Azure DevOps Service REST API 5.1 - Build Definitions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/build/definitions?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1)

agentPoolName.description: The agent pool that should execute the build. Defaults to `Hosted Ubuntu 1604`.

name.description: The name of the build definition.

projectId.description: The project ID or project name.

revision.description: The revision of the build definition

variableGroups.description: A list of variable group IDs (integers) to link to the build definition.

variables.description: A list of `variable` blocks, as documented below.

agentPoolName.description: The agent pool that should execute the build. Defaults to `Hosted Ubuntu 1604`.

name.description: The name of the build definition.

projectId.description: The project ID or project name.

variableGroups.description: A list of variable group IDs (integers) to link to the build definition.

variables.description: A list of `variable` blocks, as documented below.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering BuildDefinition resources.

agentPoolName.description: The agent pool that should execute the build. Defaults to `Hosted Ubuntu 1604`.

projectId.description: The project ID or project name.

revision.description: The revision of the build definition

variableGroups.description: A list of variable group IDs (integers) to link to the build definition.

variables.description: A list of `variable` blocks, as documented below.

features.description:
Defines the status (`enabled`, `disabled`) of the project features.  
Valid features `boards`, `repositories`, `pipelines`, `testplans`, `artifacts`

processTemplateId.description: The Process Template ID used by the Project.

versionControl.description: Specifies the version control system. Valid values: `Git` or `Tfvc`. Defaults to `Git`.

visibility.description: Specifies the visibility of the Project. Valid values: `private` or `public`. Defaults to `private`.

workItemTemplate.description: Specifies the work item template. Defaults to `Agile`.

accountLicenseType.description: Type of Account License. Valid values: `advanced`, `earlyAdopter`, `express`, `none`, `professional`, or `stakeholder`. Defaults to `express`. In addition the value `basic` is allowed which is an alias for `express` and reflects the name of the `express` license used in the Azure DevOps web interface.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the user graph subject.

licensingSource.description: The source of the licensing (e.g. Account. MSDN etc.) Valid values: `account` (Default), `auto`, `msdn`, `none`, `profile`, `trail`

origin.description: The type of source provider for the origin identifier.

originId.description: The unique identifier from the system of origin. Typically a sid, object id or Guid. e.g. Used for member of other tenant on Azure Active Directory.

principalName.description: The principal name is the PrincipalName of a graph member from the source provider. Usually, e-mail address.

accountLicenseType.description: Type of Account License. Valid values: `advanced`, `earlyAdopter`, `express`, `none`, `professional`, or `stakeholder`. Defaults to `express`. In addition the value `basic` is allowed which is an alias for `express` and reflects the name of the `express` license used in the Azure DevOps web interface.

In addition the value `basic` is allowed which is an alias for `express` and reflects the name of the `express` license used in the Azure DevOps web interface.

descriptor.description: The identity (subject) descriptor of the Group.

displayName.description: The name of a new Azure DevOps group that is not backed by an external provider. The `origin_id` and `mail` arguments cannot be used simultaneously with `display_name`.

domain.description: This represents the name of the container of origin for a graph member.

mail.description: The mail address as a reference to an existing group from an external AD or AAD backed provider. The `scope`, `origin_id` and `display_name` arguments cannot be used simultaneously with `mail`.

members.description: > NOTE: It's possible to define group members both within the `azuredevops.Identities.Group` resource via the members block and by using the   `azuredevops.Identities.GroupMembership` resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

origin.description: The type of source provider for the origin identifier (ex:AD, AAD, MSA)

originId.description: The OriginID as a reference to a group from an external AD or AAD backed provider. The `scope`, `mail` and `display_name` arguments cannot be used simultaneously with `origin_id`.

principalName.description: This is the PrincipalName of this graph member from the source provider.

scope.description: The scope of the group. A descriptor referencing the scope (collection, project) in which the group should be created. If omitted, will be created in the scope of the enclosing account or organization.x

subjectKind.description: This field identifies the type of the graph subject (ex: Group, Scope, User).

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

mail.description: The mail address as a reference to an existing group from an external AD or AAD backed provider. The `scope`, `origin_id` and `display_name` arguments cannot be used simultaneously with `mail`.

members.description: > NOTE: It's possible to define group members both within the `azuredevops.Identities.Group` resource via the members block and by using the   `azuredevops.Identities.GroupMembership` resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

scope.description: The scope of the group. A descriptor referencing the scope (collection, project) in which the group should be created. If omitted, will be created in the scope of the enclosing account or organization.x

mail.description: The mail address as a reference to an existing group from an external AD or AAD backed provider. The `scope`, `origin_id` and `display_name` arguments cannot be used simultaneously with `mail`.

However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

group.description: The descriptor of the group being managed.

members.description:
A list of user or group descriptors that will become members of the group.
> NOTE: It's possible to define group members both within the `azuredevops.Identities.GroupMembership resource` via the members block and by using the `azuredevops.Identities.Group` resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

mode.description:
The mode how the resource manages group members.
* `mode == add`: the resource will ensure that all specified members will be part of the referenced group
* `mode == overwrite`: the resource will replace all existing members with the members specified within the `members` block
> NOTE: To clear all members from a group, specify an empty list of descriptors in the `members` attribute and set the `mode` member to `overwrite`.

group.description: The descriptor of the group being managed.

members.description:
A list of user or group descriptors that will become members of the group.
> NOTE: It's possible to define group members both within the `azuredevops.Identities.GroupMembership resource` via the members block and by using the `azuredevops.Identities.Group` resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

mode.description:
The mode how the resource manages group members.
* `mode == add`: the resource will ensure that all specified members will be part of the referenced group
* `mode == overwrite`: the resource will replace all existing members with the members specified within the `members` block
> NOTE: To clear all members from a group, specify an empty list of descriptors in the `members` attribute and set the `mode` member to `overwrite`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering GroupMembership resources.

group.description: The descriptor of the group being managed.

members.description:
A list of user or group descriptors that will become members of the group.
> NOTE: It's possible to define group members both within the `azuredevops.Identities.GroupMembership resource` via the members block and by using the `azuredevops.Identities.Group` resource. However it's not possible to use both methods to manage group members, since there'll be conflicts.

mode.description:
The mode how the resource manages group members.
* `mode == add`: the resource will ensure that all specified members will be part of the referenced group
* `mode == overwrite`: the resource will replace all existing members with the members specified within the `members` block
> NOTE: To clear all members from a group, specify an empty list of descriptors in the `members` attribute and set the `mode` member to `overwrite`.

azuredevops:Pipeline/variableGroup:Varia.description:
Manages variable groups within Azure DevOps.

## Relevant Links

* [Azure DevOps Service REST API 5.1 - Variable Groups](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/distributedtask/variablegroups?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1)
* [Azure DevOps Service REST API 5.1 - Authorized Resources](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/build/authorizedresources?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1)

## PAT Permissions Required

- **Variable Groups**: Read, Create, & Manage

allowAccess.description: Boolean that indicate if this variable group is shared by all pipelines of this project.

description.description: The description of the Variable Group.

name.description: The name of the Variable Group.

projectId.description: The project ID or project name.

variables.description: One or more `variable` blocks as documented below.

azuredevops:ServiceEndpoint/gitHub:GitHu.description:
Manages a GitHub service endpoint within Azure DevOps.

## Relevant Links

* [Azure DevOps Service REST API 5.1 - Agent Pools](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/serviceendpoint/endpoints?view=azure-devops-rest-5.1)
